website_summaries.verdict: Features a lot of detailed information for both beginning collectors and experts.
pros: Photographs and detailed information on over 500 rocks and minerals
Good for both beginners and more advanced collectors
Well written, and easy to follow
Includes a special section on how to start a collection
cons: Doesn't include maps, and the way it is laid out, it can be difficult to identify rocks
Some found the print quality poor

customer_reviews.title: A Book You Can Use Over and Over
customer_reviews.text: I bought the Smithsonian Handbooks: Rocks & Minerals by Chris Pellant on Amazon. It arrived well packaged and in a timely manner. This is much more than a kids book to help with a rock collection. The book is well written and easy to follow and understand. It contains detailed information, photographs and characteristics on over 500 rocks and minerals. It is both an excellent beginners book and a reference guide.
customer_reviews.author: RJ

customer_reviews.title: So much information!
customer_reviews.text: Just received this book, bought it in "acceptable" condition, but when seeing the book it should've been "good" condition (the next level up) There's so much helpful info, it will keep me busy for a while. I'd write more, but I'm too excited to continue reading the book!
customer_reviews.author: Joz

customer_reviews.title: Good for stuff you know
customer_reviews.text: Great encyclopedic but succinct reference book for rocks and minerals. Very good pictures. The way the book is laid out it's better for finding out about a specimen you already know, than trying to identify unknowns.
customer_reviews.author: Robert E. Feder

customer_reviews.title: Packed with info
customer_reviews.text: Got as an addition to a rock and mineral activity kit for my 8 year old grandson. He loves it and so do I.
customer_reviews.author: Jim

customer_reviews.title: Confusing layout, difficult to follow especially for kids
customer_reviews.text: Some reviews had written that this would be a good book for kids who are into rock collecting. I'm sure there are some, but I haven't found a lot of success with this book. It doesn't make the topic particularly interesting, and the layout / sections make it very difficult to pick up a rock and quickly identify it. It may be decent for adults but I would not recommend for early elementary school kids.
customer_reviews.author: dannyt

customer_reviews.title: Rock photos look so real
customer_reviews.text: There was a shipping problem so it took longer than expected to get this but it was so worth it. The pictures of the rocks are so good you can put a sample beside a picture, read the description and feel like you might actually be identifying samples correctly. I am so pleased with rock pictures and descriptions. I have other rock and mineral books but this is the best so far. I may not need to buy any more!
customer_reviews.author: Mary A.

customer_reviews.title: As a beginner, I like the design of the chapters and photographs
customer_reviews.text: We bought a place that has lots of interesting rocks. I started splitting them open and testing them, which has led to some fascinating results. This book goes beyond what I have gleaned form the internet because it is organized in a manner that is educational and useful for identification. It is a bit comical to see a photo of old style floppies for storing data next to a notepad but I guess the science of geology is as old as dirt so what changes would the book need?
customer_reviews.author: LG Ripdmeov

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Reference Tool
customer_reviews.text: A perfect field guide to help identify rocks/minerals. Sturdy, thick pages and high resolution pictures that provide the origins of the rock, hardness and other required identifying characteristics.
customer_reviews.author: Scooter

customer_reviews.title: Great book for identifying rocks and minerals
customer_reviews.text: Very in-depth descriptions and high quality pictures. This book has helped me identify things in my own collection as well as stones others are trying to identify. I’ve recommended this book to a lot of new rockhounds like myself. You’re getting more than you paid for with this book it’s very nice.
customer_reviews.author: Steve R.

customer_reviews.title: Nice book with lots of detailed descriptions and clear pictures
customer_reviews.text: Descriptions are very thorough and the pictures are very vibrant and crisp. Bought this for my 5-year old son who seems to really into rocks right now. He loves the book and looks at the pictures all the time. We sometimes have tp read through some pages as a bedtime story (his idea not mine). I think I would have liked some of the geologic formation descriptions to be written in more plain language when possible, but that's a minor issue. Overall a great book.
customer_reviews.author: A. Smith

customer_reviews.title: Cute, but not great for field work
customer_reviews.text: I like that this book shows the rocks and minerals in different forms, but it doesn't give geographic regions. This is better if you're buying rocks rather than hunting. It does have sections for the different types. For the minerals, it also shows how the crystal structure should be, so that's interesting. Overall, interesting book.
customer_reviews.author: Rose Z

customer_reviews.title: Great Book
customer_reviews.text: Very good book with lots of information and pictures to help ID rocks and minerals. It also explains how they where formed. A must have book for the beginner rock collector and any pro would find it very informative and a well illustrated book.
customer_reviews.author: Charles Webster

customer_reviews.title: a Gem of a book for people interested in Rocks
customer_reviews.text: I bought this book as an aid for my Geology class, I love it. It is packed with beautiful pictures of rocks and tons of information about rocks it helped me with the identification of rocks. It is great for students.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good book, poor quality printing and faded colors.
customer_reviews.text: The information in this book is very good but the print quality is bad. Colors are not rich; they look a bit faded. The reds are not bright at all. Maybe I was expecting a book with beautiful pictures, other than a field guide, but that was my initial impression upon receiving it.
customer_reviews.author: Elise

customer_reviews.title: Good book
customer_reviews.text: Good book. Nice picture guides. Sorted in a sensible way unlike most geology books. Would recommend it. I take it on all my rock hunting adventures. I'm good at identifying but it's perfect for verifying.
customer_reviews.author: Michelle

customer_reviews.title: Outstanding Book!!
customer_reviews.text: This book is in my truck 24/7. When my son and his friends are in back, their always reading it and looking at the awesome pictures and descriptions of all the minerals and rocks. Being an amateur geologists, prospector & rock hound, this book goes with me almost everywhere.
customer_reviews.author: Phil

customer_reviews.title: Buy one in Like New or Very good if you will be using it a lot.
customer_reviews.text: I didn't make sure what condition it was in sos I got one that is starting to fall apart. I wish I had gotten a like new, or every good, since I use it a lot. I use this every week for some rock or mineral.
customer_reviews.author: Rabrat

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Book
customer_reviews.text: I love hunting for rocks, fossils and hidden gems. The Rocks and Mineral book has so much valuable information to aid in identifying rocks and minerals. It’s worth the cost and more
customer_reviews.author: Janell R

customer_reviews.title: Basic Book with limited information
customer_reviews.text: This is a very basic and limited book, better suited for beginners or children/students than those serious about gemstones. The photos, however, are just as good as any book that DK publishes: excellent.
customer_reviews.author: Maria Langer

customer_reviews.title: What the rocks are.
customer_reviews.text: I am trying to learn about the rocks I am fascinated by. This book will help, but I think I need more of a beginner book.
customer_reviews.author: Karin West

customer_reviews.title: Good value
customer_reviews.text: Wish it had even more examples. Used for identification for a rock project.
customer_reviews.author: Charlotte K.

customer_reviews.title: A great resource!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this as a Christmas gift for my son who shows a lot of interest in rocks, minerals, and geology as a whole. This is a very informative book that I think he’ll really enjoy. It’s actually so nice, I may just keep it for myself ;)
customer_reviews.author: The Optick Nerve

customer_reviews.title: There are many types of gems and rocks in central ...
customer_reviews.text: There are many types of gems and rocks in central Texas so I wanted a book to help me identify some that I have found. This book is very helpful in helping me to figure out what it is that I have found.
customer_reviews.author: Jeanne Coston

customer_reviews.title: Awesome, very informational book!
customer_reviews.text: Very awesome, informational book! Bought for my older children (10 & 12 yrs.) to learn more about rocks as we started tumbling rocks & mineras!
customer_reviews.author: Fallon Solie

customer_reviews.title: Nice little book, but not for the jewelry-making
customer_reviews.text: This book has nice photographs, each page has one type of stone or mineral described - how it looks, how it is formed in nature, and so on. But I am primary interested in identifying stones I use in my jewelry so that I can market jewelry pieces correctly. For this purpose, the book contains way too many minerals or crystals that are not used in jewelry at all. However, if you are interested in gemology in general, this is a good little book you can take with you on a field trip.
customer_reviews.author: Elena M.

customer_reviews.title: Clear & Beautifully Presented
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my 7-yr. old daughter - budding rock hound and naturalist! Like other DK books, the photography is luscious and the layout is casual and very inviting - full of beautiful images. It provides a great overview of rocks and minerals, including tools used to find them, the different characteristics and where specific types of rocks and minerals can be found. It also provides detailed "specifics" such as classification, occurence and cleavage - as appropriate. This is a thoroughly engaging book for all ages and it is highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: GJS

customer_reviews.title: Perfect For the Newbie!
customer_reviews.text: This little handbook is the perfect resource book for the newbie collector. It is filled with beautiful, detailed photos of rocks and minerals, along with necessary facts about each item. We purchased this book as a resource for our homeschooling lessons. The small size (about the size of a paperback novel) makes it easy to toss into your 'rock collecting' backpack whenever you are on the hunt for new treasures. Highly recommend for rock and mineral enthusiasts (even the Minecraft-obsessed will enjoy this book!).
customer_reviews.author: LC

customer_reviews.title: The color of the rock photos is not true
customer_reviews.text: Disappointed in the photo reproductions. But otherwise book will be useful. Wondering if the hard cover copy has better photos.
customer_reviews.author: L. Bellis

customer_reviews.title: Good book with photos of rocks and minerals.
customer_reviews.text: It is a good book for the rock hound or mineral collector. Color photos are pleantiful and of good quality. Common sedimentary and igneous rocks are covered along with minerals that are tabulated as phosphates, silicates, sulfides, sulphates, arsenides, oxides, halides, carbonates, etc. The book describes simple identification procedure for minerals such as Moh's hardness scale, scratch test, crystalline form, color, density, etc. Chemical formulas are given for minerals. It is a good value for the quality of book.
customer_reviews.author: Larry

customer_reviews.title: Worth money
customer_reviews.text: This was my first rock identification book and I love it. It's very informative, but does not go in depth on anything.
customer_reviews.author: Terry Jurek

customer_reviews.title: I especially love that it's a smaller book
customer_reviews.text: Fabulous book for anyone who is interested in rocks. I especially love that it's a smaller book, so it will easily fit into a backpack to use out on the trail. Beautiful pictures.
customer_reviews.author: NanaJam

customer_reviews.title: Great
customer_reviews.text: Fantastic book. You cannot be a rock hound without it. Super informative, great pictures, great information.
customer_reviews.author: Mark

customer_reviews.title: WONDERFUL  GUIDE!!!
customer_reviews.text: SUPER-FANTASTIC!!!!! Excellent Price!!! Bought an extra copy for a gift. Wonderful Pics and Narration!!!
customer_reviews.author: mary b. lathrop

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Topline Info
customer_reviews.text: Love these books. I have several for various topics. The illustrations and images are well done and it gives a brief yet thorough description of the specimen.
customer_reviews.author: Tiny Violet

customer_reviews.title: Fair but expected better from Smithonian.
customer_reviews.text: Don't buy it, get it used at the Library for less if you still want it. JTV has better ones for less.
customer_reviews.author: Dinamodina

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Great detail about the subject for the rock hound on the go.
customer_reviews.author: TED LEMEK

customer_reviews.title: Love this book
customer_reviews.text: Love this book! It was everything I was looking for in a rock and mineral reference book. It covers every rock and mineral type encountered in everyday life and even lets you know what type or rocks and minerals can be found together. Great for the beginner gem hunter like me. Love it!
customer_reviews.author: TM

customer_reviews.title: Knowledgable with great pictures.
customer_reviews.text: I wasn't sure to expect with this book. Usually books come in two varieties: huge pictures with dumbed-down text or zero pictures with tiny font and dizzying amounts of info. This book is the best of both worlds: medium pictures and wonderfully concise writing. Seriously, the pictures are beautiful and the the writor/editor clearly love their work. You don't need a geologist to understand this book. If you know someone that would like to be a geologist, this would be the perfect gift. Well done Smithsonian!
customer_reviews.author: Simple Sign

customer_reviews.title: great detail
customer_reviews.text: gift for Grandniece, loved it! lots of great info and photos
customer_reviews.author: Amy G

customer_reviews.title: Used by 5th grader to classify rocks.
customer_reviews.text: My son needed a couple of books to read and study about rocks for his 5th grade assignment. This book is not an introduction for kids of this grade, but shows a lot of different rocks he needs to study with a lot of descriptions and classifications of rocks, and how they distinguish from each other. This book really helped him to understand better how to classify different rocks.
customer_reviews.author: Dutch Andre in the US

customer_reviews.title: A perfect item for the true collector
customer_reviews.text: A complete guide for a novice or experienced collector. Grandson loves it.
customer_reviews.author: bob adams

customer_reviews.title: Very Handy Field Book
customer_reviews.text: I went through the book after receiving it. It is well written and very good pictures. I am a "rock-hound", collector and find this very handy as a field handbook. It's small, precise and easy to read even for my kids. I only wish it had more images or other ways to identify rocks. We have several rocks that were tumbled and are not able to be identified at this time. I do recommend for those who are serious about collecting rocks, minerals, and crystals to purchase another book that is more comprehensive and purchase this one as a field handbook.
customer_reviews.author: GJ Anderson

customer_reviews.title: Science for Grandkids
customer_reviews.text: My Grandkids needed some expanding of their outlooks. This product will help to introduce them to gems and lapidary work as well as to gold and silver smithing for jewelry as well as learning some Geology. All around a good experience for kids.
customer_reviews.author: Steve in CA

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Rock & Mineral Book !
customer_reviews.text: Perfect book for my needs ~ very explanatory and well written .
customer_reviews.author: Gia's Gems

customer_reviews.title: GREAT RESOURCE!!
customer_reviews.text: EXCELLENT BOOK - informative, explanative, great color plates! Good information - kids and adults will enjoy it if they want to learn about rocks & minerals!!! You will be able to look at the rocks/ minerals you have collected and learn about them. FUN book to have in your hands.
customer_reviews.author: one4outdoorfun

customer_reviews.title: Aboutthe only book you need on this topic!
customer_reviews.text: Detailed book with lots of pictures! I especially like the photos of polished and raw stone since the appearance can be so different.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Educational!
customer_reviews.text: Neat guide for learning the rocks and minerals in your area.
customer_reviews.author: JolenezMan4Evr

customer_reviews.title: Great book
customer_reviews.text: My 5 year old can’t get enough of this book and absolutely loves it!
customer_reviews.author: AP

customer_reviews.title: A must have
customer_reviews.text: For rock and mineral hobbyists and collectors, as well as instructors, this is a "must have" book. It is not totally complete in that it does not have every mineral but it is very comprehensive. My one kick is that in the Rock Identification Key, it shows different rocks as samples of certain characteristics but doesn't identify the rocks themselves. But even with its shortcomings, it is outstanding. I have a collection of such books and this is the best.
customer_reviews.author: Able Devildog

customer_reviews.title: Great book!
customer_reviews.text: Got this for my 10 year old for Christmas, as she has developed a love for rocks. So, I thought why not exercise her interest, and keep her interested in something beside TV. and video games! I got her a rock polisher also! This is made for adults also, but easy enough for a child that age to enjoy and learn from. Beautiful colorful pictures. I would like to keep it myself! :) Highly recommend it!
customer_reviews.author: Eyes wide openTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Actually Identify Rocks not gems!!
customer_reviews.text: We saw this book in the store, but it was cheaper here on Amazon. We purchased other reference books but they only seemed to show crystals and gem stones, not the rocks & things we were finding...This book shows it all. The only problem is the way it is layed out, other books are sectioned by color this is more by type of rock/mineral so it takes a bit longer to locate what you're looking at, but once you find it, success!!!
customer_reviews.author: C. Funk

customer_reviews.title: Great little book.
customer_reviews.text: The book arrived as promised. Packaging was secure and kept the product from being damaged. The pictures in the book were crisp and clean, colors bright and nice. The words on the page weren't too small, so that's good as this is a gift for a child. The book gives an excellent description of the rocks and minerals listed.
customer_reviews.author: Jennie750608

customer_reviews.title: Rock hound
customer_reviews.text: This is an easy to understand and very informative book. Thanks.
customer_reviews.author: Debbie

customer_reviews.title: Great book with great info!
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for some light summer reading, my boys have been looking at it for hours.
customer_reviews.author: JillHdz

customer_reviews.title: If you're a rock hound.....This is the book for you!
customer_reviews.text: This book has it all! Everything from the basics of getting started to how to identify a specific mineral or rock. It has about 99% of the information that I wanted. The only thing that it does not tell is the geographical areas of mineral occurance ( I.E. This mineral occurs only in the western regions of north america). Awesome illistrations and descriptions. Well worth the money!
customer_reviews.author: kenneth amirault

customer_reviews.title: A good learning tool
customer_reviews.text: Covers a lot of the rock specimens I have. A good learning tool.
customer_reviews.author: Don W

customer_reviews.title: Good gift!
customer_reviews.text: My friend is obsessed with rocks so I got her this book. She seemed really happy when I gave it to her. It also came in really good shape.
customer_reviews.author: Huê Tran

customer_reviews.title: Nice book to give as a gift for the rock ...
customer_reviews.text: Nice book to give as a gift for the rock hound in your life. Well illustrated & great context.
customer_reviews.author: Patricia A. Miller-Peters

customer_reviews.title: Extremely impressed
customer_reviews.text: I bought this book just for the heck of it because I'm a Geosciences major at the PENN STATE university, I was very impressed with this book. It talks in depth about the process to identify minerals, it talks about the rock cycle. It more clearly explains clevage and fractures than my instructor did. For this price, a very nice book that you'll love to look at.
customer_reviews.author: Jacob Howard

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: Very nice book with tons of info for rock hounds. Great binding too. Sure my grandson will love it.
customer_reviews.author: L. Maffett

customer_reviews.title: Good book to start learning with!
customer_reviews.text: Good book for a person just starting to learn about minerals and rocks. Nice photos. There is a newer version that is longer and also has some new images as well. Both are good for beginners and for quick reference.
customer_reviews.author: Nells250

customer_reviews.title: Travel size, full of interesting facts
customer_reviews.text: Always a great buy! Easy to read with the added bonus of learning something. Terms are presenting perfectly for any level to understand. Purchased for my 10 year old who hopes to be a geologist and she’s already burning through the book.
customer_reviews.author: Jcbdr

customer_reviews.title: This Reference Rocks!
customer_reviews.text: Excellent reference with vivid pictures and succinct descriptions - to be enjoyed by old and young! My kids loved it and spent hours poring over different kinds of rocks for their 2nd grade project. I think they will be using it well into middle and even high school.
customer_reviews.author: someoneElse

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Wonderful photographs and complete coverage of minerals. High quality paper and binding. By this one!
customer_reviews.author: Doug_in_South_Bend

customer_reviews.title: I LOVE THESE BOOKS!
customer_reviews.text: i havent read a whole book since graduate school but have never stopped learning about things. we have the entire collection and i now devour them cover to cover. i purchased almost all of them on Amazon for $5-$13 each (verses the $20 cover price). my kids and i LOVE to read these books and learn about the rocks, fossils and nature we find camping and fishing. smithsonian/DK even makes flags interesting!
customer_reviews.author: J. Fogle

customer_reviews.title: A quality mid-level rock book
customer_reviews.text: I bought this as a gift from my 13 year old niece - she actually cried. She loved this, found it informative and easily accessible. Not as simple as some of the smaller pocket books, but not as complicated as some of the geologist specialty books.
customer_reviews.author: LVNmommy

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: I always LOVED rocks and I have a nice rock collection so this book is very helpful to me.
customer_reviews.author: Johnny124

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Love this book for myself. Refer to it on a regular basis.
customer_reviews.author: Jane Doe

customer_reviews.title: Typical high-quality DK press book
customer_reviews.text: I love any books it seems that come from DK; they are high quality, informative and all around great guides. I have several of their travel guides, and this book on Rocks and Minerals keeps up to their high standards. Really well done and useful book, especially if you want to easily identify a large variety of rocks.
customer_reviews.author: michibilly

customer_reviews.title: ... rocks and minerals would have met my needs much better. This is a little too much too soon ...
customer_reviews.text: I think a pictorial chart of the different rocks and minerals would have met my needs much better. This is a little too much too soon for a beginner like me.
customer_reviews.author: summer75

customer_reviews.title: Rock On
customer_reviews.text: Nice professional rock book. The author did a excellent job on the photos and the quality of paper used. This book works great for a field guide and has inrtricate pictures which helps you identify many types of rocks in the field. I give it two thumbs up.
customer_reviews.author: Coos Bay Chris

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Good book, a little smaller then I was expecting but a nice read.
customer_reviews.author: david akins

customer_reviews.title: THE book for young rock hounds.
customer_reviews.text: Very good book for young and old rock hounds. Contains great pictures and descriptions of many rocks and minerals. Our 9 year old grandson is having a blast with it and some rocks we gave him. Great learning tool from a reputable source.
customer_reviews.author: R. AUDETTE

customer_reviews.title: Good Book on Rocks
customer_reviews.text: Well illustrated technical book by the Smithsonian. Colorful illustrations.....a beautiful colored picture is worth 10 thousand words! When Rock Hunting. There is a lot to learn in this Smithsonian book. JJF
customer_reviews.author: Comet Cowboy 46

customer_reviews.title: Great for Beginner
customer_reviews.text: Great book for beginner like myself. Filled with useful information and detailed pictures.
customer_reviews.author: CDB

customer_reviews.title: 8  year old daughter loves it!
customer_reviews.text: My 8 year old daughter, who is a big lover of rocks, adores this book. She can look through it for a while and not get exhausted of it. The pictures are bright and beautiful and the information is very clear and educational. Glad we purchased this book!
customer_reviews.author: Amanda Forbes

customer_reviews.title: Very useful. best for minerals, good for rocks
customer_reviews.text: The descriptions and illustrations are very good, and the content is comprehensive. I bought it for rock identification, though, and it has a lot more information on minerals than it does on rocks. I would have appreciated the reverse.
customer_reviews.author: Tom Walton

customer_reviews.title: Three Stars
customer_reviews.text: Good for beginners. I was hoping to learn more than what the book has.
customer_reviews.author: Dheimonte

customer_reviews.title: Bought this book for my son to use in identifying ...
customer_reviews.text: Bought this book for my son to use in identifying the rocks and minerals he has. He loves it and plans on taking it with him the next time he goes looking for more.
customer_reviews.author: tam

customer_reviews.title: Smithsonian Handbooks: Rocks and Minerals
customer_reviews.text: This should come in handy every time my sister and I go mining (we plan to return to Mason's Mine in a few weeks). In fact, I keep that book and a few others in my backpack for quick reference in the field. I'll be using it in a few days, once I can make time to go through the specimens I brought back.
customer_reviews.author: Russell A. Ligeikis

customer_reviews.title: A must have
customer_reviews.text: Husband won't put the book down. If you have a rock liver in your house....this is a must have book
customer_reviews.author: Vicky

customer_reviews.title: Otherwise it is an extremely useful book and I would recommend it to anyone
customer_reviews.text: The book has the mohs scale Mohs scales, but I saw one on a hyperbolic curve in a different box that shows the real difference between 1 Talic and 10 Diamond. Otherwise it is an extremely useful book and I would recommend it to anyone.
customer_reviews.author: Charlie Mac

customer_reviews.title: Beautiful book.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this book because it reminded me of one my mother had given me as a child. I'm not sure if this one is an update or a totally different book but it is very nice. The one I had as a child started a life-long fascination with the subject. I'm hoping to share it with and pass it along to my grandchildren. The book offers a great introduction into the world of rocks and minerals and how they're formed, and the photos are large and beautiful. I would recommend this handbook to anyone that is interested in the subject. Also, the service was great; it arrived promptly and was in perfect condition.
customer_reviews.author: Bruce D. Colgate

customer_reviews.title: Awesome and Educational!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this book for my daughter who loves rocks, and we have learned so much in such a little time. We are starting a collection and wanted to know exactly what we were picking up, this book is extremely helpful.
customer_reviews.author: Chulo Diaz

customer_reviews.title: It I a great book for all ages
customer_reviews.text: This item was purchased to go the with item above. I have had several copies of this particular book, but have given them away to Scout Troops in order that the young scouts can learn more toward their Geology Merit Badge. It I a great book for all ages.
customer_reviews.author: Robert Hamilton

customer_reviews.title: my rock book
customer_reviews.text: this book is what i was hoping it would be, a field pocket guide to help me with my work. thank you Amazon
customer_reviews.author: ray moore

customer_reviews.title: Great book, nice size for being able to take ...
customer_reviews.text: Great book, nice size for being able to take it with me. The only thing that's missing is where the rocks and minerals can be found - that would be very helpful for rock hounds!
customer_reviews.author: TheBax

customer_reviews.title: I wanted meat.  I got weak broth.
customer_reviews.text: I was hoping for a useful reference book. It is not. As a result I only skimmed it. It may be good to get kids interested in the science of geology, or for casual rockhounds.
customer_reviews.author: Clarence E.

customer_reviews.title: Great Book!
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my granddaughter, we are both rock hounds and we will take this with us when we go looking for treasure!!! Her bday is a few weeks off so we have not used it yet but the book looks great with great pictures!!
customer_reviews.author: danigo2

customer_reviews.title: The photos are fantastic and the geology discussion is perfect for a newbie ...
customer_reviews.text: I got this for my 8 year old nephew who has a fascination with rocks. The photos are fantastic and the geology discussion is perfect for a newbie to the rock game! He absolutely Loved it!
customer_reviews.author: Sora

customer_reviews.title: Rocks Book Rocks
customer_reviews.text: This is an excellent guide for one who is interested in learning about collecting rocks and minerals. If one takes the time to study the introductory chapters, the book works well.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas Marble

customer_reviews.title: Great information
customer_reviews.text: Well written, enough detail for the beginner to study a wide variety of rocks
customer_reviews.author: Lyn

customer_reviews.title: But very cool pictures and I formative
customer_reviews.text: I wish it had the pronunciations. But very cool pictures and I formative.
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: Smithsonian Hankbook: Rocks & Minerals
customer_reviews.text: This was a gift, I did hear back from the person I gave it to: I enjoying the book you sent me.
customer_reviews.author: MJ Webb.

customer_reviews.title: great for anyone looking for a field manual to reference
customer_reviews.text: In depth information on a variety of rocks and minerals, great for anyone looking for a field manual to reference.
customer_reviews.author: martin

customer_reviews.title: Cool
customer_reviews.text: One of two field guides I purchased. They're my first and I'd say I'm very impressed. I don't know jack about rocks or minerals or gems or that there is a difference. I liked this book a lot because it adds the chemical composition and it's broken down very nicely. A little history, a little insight. Each page has a couple of different rocks on it with what it is along with a picture. Really nice little book.
customer_reviews.author: Rudi

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Both my husband and myself have enjoyed this book! Very helpful!
customer_reviews.author: Nicki-2

customer_reviews.title: ... are a want to be scientist this is a great book for you
customer_reviews.text: If you are a want to be scientist this is a great book for you! For me it is just too much information that I have not a clue about. Delivery and packaging was very good.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: A gorgeous book, well illustrated and easy to read!
customer_reviews.text: I am taking a geology course and the text I need for mineralogy is virtually non-existent. I bought this book hoping for a nice companion book to my main textbook, but I was surprised at the fact I refer to this book for mineral identification more than I do on my $100 textbook.
customer_reviews.author: Ronnie Bruner

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my five year old that loves rocks. She loves looking at the pictures!
customer_reviews.author: beccaboo
